subject: Productivity
title: The Internet and Global Collaboration
description: A fast breakdown of The Internet and Global Collaboration for builders.

hook.text: In 1995, fewer than 1% of the world was online. By 2020, over 60% was connected.

buildup.text: The internet collapsed distance. A team in Tokyo could work with a team in London in real time.

discovery.text: Email, video calls, and shared documents made global collaboration routine, not exceptional.

twist.text: But always-on connectivity blurred work and life. The office followed you home, then everywhere.

climax.text: The internet gave us infinite reach and infinite distraction in the same package.

punchline.text: The internet connected everything, including your work to your weekend.

quiz.question: What major challenge did internet connectivity create for productivity?
options: It blurred the boundary between work and personal life
It eliminated the need for teamwork
